page.title: 13Plants and Animals
page.content: { Traditional hedgerows}have been kept as field boundaries,{plants} such as blackberry,elderberry,holly, hawthorne elderberry,holly,hawthorne and honeysuckle all appearing. Consequently there is abundant food and nesting material for{animals, squirrel,mice and hedgehogs,hares, rabbits foxes and stoats are to be found. There are a variety of{British Trees including oak,ash,mountain ash,beech and sycamore. These provide food and shelter for the{bird}population. { }Robins,jackdaws,chaffinch,blackbirds wrens,tits,house martins are all regular visitors to our gardens. { Bracken,gorse}and{heather}in the moorland areas make excellent cover for{pheasants,partridge}and{curlews these in turn, of course, attract {kestrels, owls}and{sparrow hawks.
